title: copy account from one computer to another
creator: Tony_Aston
content:
I have a MacBook Air and an iMac desk top computer. There are 6 email accounts on the MacBook Air and 4 on the iMac. I am using Thunderbird MacBook Air 115.12.2 (64 bit) and on the iMac 140.6.esr (64 bit). For some reason I am unable to set up the 5th account on the iMac (Wrong password etc)

Can I just export the 5th account on MacBook Air and import that account on the iMac? The export file (I guess all accounts) is 8.17 GB .

If I import that file to the iMac will I duplicate the emails already associated with the existing 4 accounts or will I be able to select which account I want to import along with the associated settings and passwords?

Thank you, Ton Aston

title: Add-on Allow HTML Temp not compatible with TBird 146.0.1
creator: itdcmy
content:
Since the upgrade to Thunderbird 146, the plugin for Allow HTML Temp has been disabled. Following Find an alternative add-on button, I get directed to an upgraded version of the add-on 10.1.1, see screen clip, which states it should be OK up to version 147.

I had the same problem last time the upgrade was to Tbird 144 and Allow HTML Temp add-on was updated to 10.0.8. I followed up with the add-on developer who claimed it was Thunderbird is erroneously rejecting the add-on. They said "Thunderbird itself checks the compatiblity on add-on installation at AMO, where the add-on version 10.0.8 is marked as compatible up to 144 at the moment." I don't understand what the "AMO" term means. The developer sent me a modified version of their update, but closed the issue with "Not an Add-on Issue. Compatibility check on AMO failed."

It looks like the same problem is happening again. Can you please tell me if this is a problem with Thunderbird checking, or is it with the add-on? When will this type of issue be solved?

(I was also told by the developer that I might have changed some feature of Thunderbird from standard, but that is not true)
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:140.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/140.0

title: Não consigo acesso ao imap Gmail após instalar o Thunderbird 146.0.1
creator: anderson.c.t
content:
Após atualizar para o Thunderbird 146.0.1 perdi acesso ao meu email do gmail.

Segui as instruções do gmail para configurar novamente:

"Configurar o Gmail em outro cliente de e-mail Para adicionar o Gmail a outro cliente de e-mail: Use a opção "Fazer login com o Google"

A resposta do google foi: "400. Isso é um erro. A solicitação é inválida e não pode ser processada pelo servidor. Não tente novamente. Isso é tudo o que sabemos."

Tentei configurar o Thunderbird manualmente usando os dados: Servidor de envio de e-mails (SMTP): smtp.gmail.com Requer SSL: Sim Requer TLS: Sim (se disponível) Requer autenticação: sim Porta para TLS/STARTTLS: 587

Continuou não funcionando.

Entrei em contato com o suporte do google e não souberam o que fazer, empurraram o problema pedindo para contatar o desenvolvedor do Thunderbird.

Segue a tela de erro do google

title: One of two Yahoo mail accounts not downloading messages
creator: LewisJay
content:
I am using Thunderbird 140.6.0esr (64-bit) desktop on Windows 11. I have multiple email accounts setup, two of which are Yahoo accounts. On 12/21, one of the Yahoo accounts stopped delivering messages to Thunderbird from Yahoo while the other continues to download them. Thunderbird does logon to Yahoo for the account in question and gives me a message that there are no messages to download. When I logon to Yahoo mail through a browser, there is plenty of mail that has been received after 12/21 which should be downloading.

Both of the Yahoo accounts are setup exactly the same... POP Mail Server pop.mail.yahoo.com Port 995 SSL / TLS OAuth2

Outgoing server smtp.mail.yahoo.com Port 465 SSL / TLS OAuth2

I removed the password from Thunderbird for the account not delivering mail, re-entered it, restarted Thunderbird and got the same results. I changed the password (through yahoo mail), entered the new password into Thunderbird and got the same results. I also tried restarting Thunderbird again after entering the new password which made no difference.

Any help and suggestions would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks, Lew
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/143.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

content:

To be clear, my policy has always been to create new accounts for "A, B, C, and D" for each new year like what you see, left to right, in "Image-1." That has made it the easiest for any research about prior received or sent messages.

Attempting to do that now doesn't work. I put info in every panel; I setup for POP3 and enter a new password; then click Continue and get the message you see, left to right, in "Image-2."  :-(

I could really use some specific, successful advice ... PLEASE!  :-)
